newsitem.title: ISRAEL: Palestinians call strike over Jerusalem building.
newsitem.headline: Palestinians call strike over Jerusalem building.

text.p: Palestinian lawmakers on Saturday called a general strike in the West Bank and Gaza Strip for Monday to protest Israeli plans to build housing for Jews in Arab East Jerusalem.

The Palestinian Legislative Council held an emergency meeting in the West Bank town of Ramallah and called for a "general and full strike on Monday March 3" against Israel's recent decision to build the 6,500 homes.

Palestinians have been enraged by the decision that they say completes a ring of Jewish settlements around Jerusalem and obstructs the possibility of turning the eastern part of the city into the capital of a future Palestinian state.
Israel captured East Jerusalem in the 1967 Middle East war.
The Palestinian council described the Israeli construction as "null, illegal and rejected" by the Palestinian people and said it was in contradiction with United Nations resolutions.
Israel and the PLO are due to discuss the final status of Jerusalem in negotiations due to start later this month and end in 1999.
